meanings.def: to become healthy again; to make something healthy again
examples: It took a long time for the wounds to heal.
heal up The cut healed up without leaving a scar.
heal something This will help to heal your cuts and scratches.
(figurative) It was a chance to heal the wounds in the party (= to repair the damage that had been done).
Her heel caught in the stairs and she tumbled down.

meanings.def: to cure somebody who is ill; to make somebody feel happy again
examples: the story of Jesus healing ten lepers of their disease
I felt healed by his love.

meanings.def: to put an end to something or make something easier to bear; to end or become easier to bear
examples: She was never able to heal the rift between herself and her father.
The breach between them never really healed.
